column1: Two numbers are in the ratio [a] to [b] . If the sum of numbers is [c] , find the numbers .
[a] trains leave simultaneously traveling on the same track in opposite directions at speeds of [b] and [c] miles per hour . How many hours will it take before they are [d] miles apart ?
Find two numbers whose sum is [a] if one number is [b] times as large as the other number.
Tickets at a local theater cost [a] dollars for adults and [b] dollars dollars for kids under twelve . If [c] tickets were sold and the profit was [d] dollars , how many kid tickets were sold ?
[a] people go to a zoo . Tickets are [b] dollars for adults and [c] dollars for kids . Total sales are [d] dollars . How many adults went to zoo ? How many kids ?

The St . Mark 's Community Barbecue served [a] dinners . A child 's plate cost [b] dollars and an adult 's plate cost [c] dollars . A total of [d] dollars was collected . How many child 's plates were served ? How many adult 's plates were served ?

Wal-Mart sells thermometers for [a] dollars, and hot-water bottles for [b] dollars . Total sales for these [a] items during the month of January was [c] dollars . There were [d] times as many thermometers as hot-water bottles sold . How many thermometers were sold ? How many hot-water bottles ?

A [a] % acid solution and a [b] % acid solution must be mixed to produce [c] liters of a [d] % acid solution . How many liters of [a] % acid solution should be used ? How many liters of [b] % acid solution should be used ?

Suppose you invested [a] dollars , part at [b] % annual interest and the rest at [c] % annual interest . If you received [d] dollars in interest after one year , how much did you invest at [b] % annual interest and at [c] % annual interest ?
A recipe calls for [a] cups of sugar . You find that you only have [b] cups of sugar left . What fraction of the recipe can you make ?
Tickets to a local movie were sold at [a] dollars for adults and [b] dollars for students . If [c] tickets were sold for a total of [d] dollars , how many student tickets were sold ?
[a] of Joe 's income each month goes to taxes . If she pays [b] dollars in taxes each month , what is her monthly income in dollars ?
Jordan 's salary is [a] dollars a month plus a [b] % commission on all of his sales . What must the amount of his sales be , in dollars , for him to earn at least [c] dollars each month ?

A petroleum company has two different sources of crude oil . The first source provides crude oil that is [a] % hydrocarbons and the second one provides crude oil that is [b] % hydrocarbons . In order to obtain [c] gallons of crude oil that is [d] % hydrocarbons , how many gallons of crude oil must be used from each of the two sources ?
Steve has [a] coins consisting of dimes and nickels . If the value of the coins is [b] dollars , then how many dimes does he have ?
The selling price of a pair of pants is [a] dollars . If the store paid [b] dollars less for the pants , find the price that the store paid , in dollars .

A [a] % sugar solution is added to an [b] % sugar solution to create [c] milliliters of a [d] % solution . How many milliliters of the [a] % solution should be used ? How many millileters of the [b] % solution ?

A department store held a sale to sell all of the [a] winter jackets that remained after the season ended . Until noon , each jacket in the store was priced at [b] dollars . At noon , the price of the jackets was further reduced to [c] dollars . After the last jacket was sold , the total receipts for the clearance sale were [d] dollars . How many jackets were sold before noon and how many jackets were sold after noon ?
The sum of [a] of a number and two is eight . Find the number .
The sum of [a] numbers is [b] . [c] times one of the numbers is [d] less than [e] times the other . What is the smaller number ? What is the larger number ?
[a] less than [b] times a number equals [c] . What is the number ?

A bricklayer lays an average of [a] bricks per hour . During a job , he is called away and replaced by a less experienced man , who averages [b] bricks per hour . The two men laid [c] bricks in [d] hours . How long did each work ?

The Drama Club sold [a] tickets for the end-of-year-performance . Admission prices were [b] dollars for adults and [c] dollars for students . The total amount collected at the box office was [d] dollars . How many students attended the play ? How many adult attended the play ?
The number of boys in eighth grade is [a] less than twice the number of girls . There are [b] students in eighth grade . How many are girls ?
The sum of [a] numbers is [b] . Twice the larger number exceeds [c] times the smaller number by [d] . Find the number.
It took me [a] minutes to walk [b] meters . How fast was I travelling ?
Paul has [a] postcards . He has [b] times as many large postcards as small postcards . How many small postcards does he have ? How many large postcards ?

Student tickets cost [a] dollars and general admission tickets cost [b] dollars . You sell [c] tickets and collect [d] dollars . How many student tickets did you sell ? How many general admission tickets did you sell ?
The total cost of a pair of pants and a belt was [a] dollars . If the price of the pair of pants was [b] dollars less than the belt , what was the price of the pair of pants ?

A merchant wants to combine peanuts selling [a] dollars per pound and cashews selling for [b] dollars per pound to form [c] pounds which will sell at [d] dollars per pound . What amount of peanuts and what amount of cashews must be used ?
Marco has [a] coins , all nickels and dimes . He has [b] more dimes than nickels . How many nickels and how many dimes does he have ?

A farmer grows only sunflowers and flax on his [a] acre farm . This year he wants to plant [b] more acres of sunflowers than flax . How many acres of sunflowers does the farmer need to plant ? How many acres of flax ?

[a] high speed trains are [b] miles apart and traveling toward each other . They meet in [c] hours . If one train is [d] miles per hour faster than the other , find the speed of the slower train in miles per hour . Find the speed of the faster train .
[a] is divided in two parts such that [b] time the first part added to [c] times the second part makes [d] . What is the first part ?
You had [a] dollars to spend and purchased [b] sets of dishes . If you spent everything , how many [c] dollars sets did you purchase ? How many [d] dollars sets did you purchase ?

During a 4th of July weekend , [a] vehicles became trapped on the Sunshine Skyway Bridge while it was being repaved . A recent city ordinance decreed that only cars with [b] wheels and trucks with six wheels could be on the bridge at any given time . If there were [c] tires that needed to be replaced to due to damage , how many cars and trucks were involved in the incident ?
There are [a] animals total , all sheep and chickens . If there are [b] legs total , how many of the [a] animals are sheep ? How many are chickens ?
Arthur bought [a] hamburgers and [b] hot dogs for [c] dollars . The next day , he bought [d] hamburgers and [a] hot dogs for [e] dollars . How much does a hot dog cost ?

An auditorium has [a] balcony seats and [b] main-level seats . If tickets for balcony seats will cost [c] dollars less than tickets for main-level seats , what should the prices be for the main-level seats and prices for the balcony seats , so that the total revenue from a sellout performance will be [d] ?

E-Chem Testing has a solution that is [a] % base and another that is [b] % base . A technician needs [c] liters of a solution that is [d] % base . The [c] liters will be prepared by mixing the two solutions on hand . How much of the [a] % base and the [b] % base should be used ?
One year Walt invested [a] dollars . He invested part of the money at [b] % and the rest at [c] % . He made a total of [d] dollars in interest . How much was invested at [b] % ?

The cost of [a] gallons of regular gasoline and [b] gallons of premium gasoline is [c] dollars . Premium costs [d] dollars more per gallon than regular . What is the cost per gallon of each type of gasoline ?

To make a weak solution of [a] liters of [b] % acid , a lab technician will use some premixed solutions : one is [c] % acid and the other is [d] % acid . How many liters of each , respectively , should he use to obtain the desired solution ?

Ilida went to Minewaska Sate Park one day this summer . All of the people at the park were either hiking or bike riding . There were [a] more hikers than bike riders . If there were a total of [b] people at the park , how many were hiking ? How many were riding their bikes ?
Soybean meal is [a] % protein ; cornmeal is [b] % protein . How many pounds of each should be mixed together in order to get a 320-pound mixture that is [c] % protein ?
In a class of [a] students the number of girls is [b] of the number of boys . Find the number of girls in the class.
The number of grocery items on two grocery lists differs by [a] . The total number of items is [b] . How many items are on each list ?

A baseball team has home games on Wednesday and Saturday . The two games together earn [a] dollars for the team . Wednesdays game generates [b] dollars less than Saturdays game . How much money was taken in at Wednesday 's game ? How much money was taken in at Saturday 's game ?

The Coffee Counter charges [a] dollars per pound for Kenyan French Roast coffee and [b] dollars per pound for Sumatran coffee . How many pounds of Kenyan French Roast and Sumatran should be used to make a 20-pound blend that sells for [c] dollars per pound ?

A concert sells out a [a] seat arena . Main seat tickets cost [b] dollars , and back seat tickets for [c] dollars . The concert made [d] dollars . How many main seat tickets and back seat tickets were sold ?
A high school graduating class is made up of [a] students . There are [b] more girls than boys . How many boys are in the class ?
[a] Pairs of jeans and [b] shirts costs [c] dollars . The cost of [d] jeans and [e] shirts is [f] dollars . Find the cost of each pair of jeans and each shirt.

Maggie has a job working in an office for [a] dollars an hour and another job driving a tractor for [b] dollars an hour . One week she works in the office twice as long as she drives the tractor . Her total income for that week is [c] dollars . How many hours did she spend at the office ? How many hours driving the tractor ?
The world 's oldest bride was [a] yr older than her groom . Together , their ages totaled [b] years . How old was the bride ? How old was the groom ?

[a] teams of scientists leave a university at the same time in special vans to search for tornadoes . the 1st team travel east at [b] miles per hour and the 2nd team travels west at [c] miles per hour . their radios have a range of [d] miles . How much time will pass before the scientists lose radio contact ?

A catering company is setting up tables for a big event that will host [a] people . When they set up the tables they need [b] forks for each child and [c] forks for each adult . If the company ordered a total of [d] forks , how many adults and how many children will be attending the event ?
A discount store sold plastic cups for [a] dollars each and ceramic cups for [b] dollars each . If [c] cups were sold for a total of [d] dollars , how many plastic cups and ceramic cups were sold ?

In a given week , the first car gets an average of [a] miles per gallon , and the second car gets [b] miles per gallon . The two cars combined drive a total of [c] miles in that week , for a total gas consumption of [d] gallons . How many gallons were consumed by the first car that week ? How many gallons were consumed by the second car that week ?

In a family there are [a] cars . The sum of the average miles per gallon obtained by the two cars in a particular week is [b] . The first car has consumed [c] gallons during that week , and the second car has consumed [d] gallons , for a total of [e] miles driven by the two cars combined . What was the average gas mileage obtained by each of the [a] cars that week ?
There were [a] people at a play . The admission price was [b] dollars for adults and [c] dollars for children . The admission receipts were [d] dollars . How many adults and children attended ?
The sum of [a] numbers is [b] . [c] of the first number plus [d] of the second number is [e] . Find the smaller and the larger number.

Didi invested a total of [a] dollars in two accounts paying [b] % and [c] % simple interest . If her total return at the end of the first year was [d] dollars , how much did she invest in each account ?

In the 2000-2001 baseball season , the Seattle Mariners tied a league record set by the [a] Chicago Cubs for most wins in a season . The Mainers won [b] more than twice as many games as they lost . They played [c] regular season games . How many wins and losses did the mariners have ?

One unit of whole wheat flour has [a] grams of protein and [b] grams of fat . One unit of whole milk has [c] grams of protein and [d] grams of fat . To the nearest tenth , find the number of units of whole wheat flour and whole milk that must be mixed to make dough that has [e] grams of protein and [f] grams of fat .

A physician 's assistant measures a child and finds that his height is [a] inches . At his last visit to the doctor's office , the child was [b] inches tall . How much did the child grow , in inches ?
If [a] pounds of ground beef costs [b] dollars , how much does [c] pounds of ground beef cost ?

A theater sells children 's tickets for [a] dollars and adult tickets for [b] dollars . One night [c] tickets worth [d] dollars were sold . How many adult tickets were sold ? How many children 's tickets ?

Mario has [a] pence to invest and decides to invest part of it at [b] % and the rest of it at [c] % . If the total interest for the year is [d] pence, how much does Mario has to invest at [b] % rate and how much does she has to invest at [c] % rate ?
Purses cost [a] dollars each . Scarves cost [b] dollars each . [c] combined items sold costing [d] dollars total . How many purses were sold ? How many scarves were sold ?
Pedro goes to the market and buys a total of [a] plums and peaches for [b] dollars . A plum costs [c] dollars and a peach costs [d] dollars . How many plums did Pedro buy ?
A bottle of wine with a cork cost [a] dollars . A bottle of wine without a cork costs [b] dollars more than the cork . What is the price of the cork ?

Mrs.Martin bought [a] cups of coffee and [b] bagels and spent [c] dollars . Mr.Martin bought [b] cups of coffee and [d] bagels and spent [e] dollars . Find the cost of one cup of coffee and the cost of one bagel.
A total of [a] tickets were sold for the school play . The number of student tickets sold was two times the number of adult tickets sold . How many adult tickets were sold ?
The length of a rectangular field is [a] meters . This is [b] meters less than twice the width . Find the width.
The sum of two numbers is [a] . The difference between three times the smaller number and the larger number is [b] . Find the smaller number and the larger number.
A piece of rope [a] meters long is cut into two pieces so that the longest piece is twice as long as the shorter piece . How long are the two pieces ?
There are [a] animals on a farm , each of which is either a pig or a chicken . There are [b] legs altogether . How many pigs are there ? How many chickens ?

Hockey teams receive [a] points when they win and [b] point when they tie . [b] season , a team won a championship with [c] points . They won [d] games more than they tied . How many wins and ties did the team have ?

On a canoe trip , Rita paddled upstream at an average speed of [a] miles per hour relative to the riverbank . On the return trip downstream, her average speed was [b] miles per hour . Find Rita 's paddling speed in still water and the speed of the river 's current .
Six apples and three oranges cost [a] dollars . Two apples and five oranges cost [b] dollars . Find the cost of each apple and the cost of an orange .

A chemist has two acid solutions . One solution is [a] % pure acid and the other is [b] % pure acid . How much of [a] % pure acid and [b] % pure acid is needed to produce [c] square-centimeters of a solution that is [d] % pure acid ?

A cosmetologist has a bottle of [a] % hydrogen peroxide solution and a bottle of [b] % hydrogen peroxide solution . The cosmetologist needs [c] milliliters of a [d] % hydrogen peroxide solution . Find how many milliliters of each solution the cosmetologist needs to mix together.
Mitch is buying candy bars for his friends . He wants to give [a] bars to each friend , and he wants to have [b] spare bars . He can afford to buy [c] candy bars . How many friends can he treat ?
Bob invested [a] dollars , part at [b] % and part at [c] % . If the total interest at the end of the year is [d] dollars , how much did he invest at [b] % ?

An airplane begins a flight with a total of [a] gallons of fuel stored in two separate wing tanks . During the flight , [b] % of the fuel in one tank is used , and in the other tank , [c] % of the fuel is used . If the total fuel used is [d] gallons , what are the amounts x and y stored in each tank .

John is writing an article . The article is limited to [a] words . He decides to use two types of font . Large font is [b] words per page , small font is [c] words per page . He is allowed [d] pages for this article . How many pages are in small font ? How many pages are in large font ?
Find two numbers whose sum is [a] and whose difference is [b]

Adult tickets for a show cost [a] dollars while children 's tickets cost [b] dollars . If there were twice as many adults as children and the total receipts for the show were [c] dollars . How many adults were at the show ?
The total number of Democrats and Republicans in the House of Representatives was [a] . There were [b] more Republicans then Democrats . How many Democrats and Republicans were there in the Senate ?
Find a number such that [a] more than [b] the number is [c] the number.
A 177-inch pipe is cut into two pieces . One piece is two times the length of the other . Find the lengths of the two pieces.

Jack collects baseball and football cards . He has [a] cards total . The number of baseball cards he has is five more than three times the number of football cards . How many baseball and football cards does he have ?

Your cell phone company offers two text-messaging plans . Plan A costs [a] dollars per text message , plus a monthly fee of [b] dollars . The other plan costs [c] dollars per text message with no monthly fee . For how many text messages will both plans cost the same amount ?

A self-employed contractor nearing retirement made two investments totaling [a] dollars . In one year , these investments yielded [b] dollars in simple interest . Part of the money was invested at [c] % and the rest at [d] % . How much was invested at each rate ?

Steve invests in a circus production . The coast includes an overhead of [a] dollars , plus production costs of [b] dollars per performance . A sold-out performance brings in [c] dollars , Determine the number of sold-out performances , x , needed to break even .
One number is [a] more than [b] times another number . Their sum is [c] . Find the smaller number.
Lisa invested [a] dollars , part at [b] % and the rest at [c] % per year . How much did she invest at [b] % and [c] % if her total return per year on the investments was [d] dollars ?

An art dealer sold [a] etchings for [b] dollars . He sold some of them at [c] dollars each and the rest at [d] dollars each . How many etchings did he sell at [c] dollars ? How many etchings did he sell at [d] dollars ?

A plane flying with a tail wind flew at a speed of [a] miles per hour , relative to the ground . When flying against the tailwind , it flew at a speed of [b] miles per hour . Find the speed of the tailwind .

At Al 's Rent-a-Center , it costs [a] dollars more per month to rent a leather couch than it does to rent a microfiber couch . Pauline rented a leather couch for [b] months and then exchanged it for a microfiber couch , which she rented for [c] months . She paid a total of [d] dollars to rent these couches . Solve this system of equations to find the monthly rental charge for the leather couch , in dollars . Find the monthly rental charge for the microfiber couch .
One integer is twice another , and their sum is [a] . Find the smaller and larger integer .
Your teacher is giving a test worth [a] points . There is a total of [b] 5-point and 10-point questions . How many 5-point questions are on the test ?
